page.topic: Managing Python Packages in a Project

description.p: Install required Python packages for your application from within the Alpha Anywhere IDE.

discussion.p: You can use PIP to install Python modules into your Web Project. To open the PIP installer, click *[ui:More...]* on the Web Projects Control Panel toolbar. Then, select *[ui:Python]* > *[ui:Install a Python Package (using PIP) command]*.

description.p: You can browse available Python packages using the *[ui:Browse...]* button in the *[ui:Install Python Package]* dialog.

Clicking *[ui:Browse...]* opens a dialog where you can search for a Python package. Use the search box to search for a package. Select the desired package from the list. Then, click the *[ui:Copy to clipboard]* icon next to the pip install command listed below the package name to select the package.

figure.title: Copy the pip install command from the package page
figure.alt: Copy the pip install command from the package page

description.p: Next, click *[ui:Close]*. The selected package will appear in the *[ui:Package]* text box. Click *[ui:Install...]* to install the package.
Python packages are installed to a folder called *[python]* in the web root of the Web Project.
To remove a Python package from your project, delete the package folder from the *[python]* directory in the Web Project.
